p: This approach is most likely to be successful with NoV VLPs as NoV naturally infects the gastrointestinal system and, therefore, is resistant to denaturation and digestion in the oral-gastrointestinal tract [ 31, 107]. Moreover, their resemblance to the native virus allows them to be efficiently sampled by the “M” cells of the gut epithelium and transported into GALT for antigen processing and presentation [ 102]. Thus, VLPs produced in edible plants represent a novel and cost-effective approach to establishing gut mucosal immunity by oral delivery [ 135– 137]. As a vaccine is required to have a defined dosage unit, this strategy may face regulatory hurdles for commercialization in developed countries [ 102, 123, 124]. However, this strategy may eventually offer a feasible option for commercial vaccine delivery by oral route, especially as more consistent VLP accumulation per unit of plant tissue is being achieved by the new generation of expression vectors.
